rstem.led_matrix package¶

Submodules¶

rstem.led_matrix.led_matrix module¶

class rstem.led_matrix.led_matrix.LEDSprite(filename=None, height=0, width=0, color=0)[source]¶

Bases: object

Allows the creation of a LED Sprite that is defined in a text file. - The text file must only contain hex numbers 0-9, a-f, A-F, or - (dash) - The hex number indicates pixel color and “-” indicates a transparent pixel

append(sprite)[source]¶

Appends given sprite to the right of itself - height of given sprite must be <= to itself otherwise will be truncated

get_pixel(x, y)[source]¶

Returns int of color at given origin or None

rotate(angle=90)[source]¶

Rotates sprite at 90 degree intervals. If no angle given, will rotate sprite 90 degrees.

rotated(angle=90)[source]¶

Returns a rotated LEDSprite of self. Does not change self.

save_to_file(filename)[source]¶
set_pixel(point, color=15)[source]¶

Sets given color to given x and y coordinate in sprite - color can be a int or string of hex value - return None if coordinate is not valid

rstem.led_matrix.led_matrix.display_on_terminal()[source]¶
rstem.led_matrix.led_matrix.erase()[source]¶
rstem.led_matrix.led_matrix.fill(color=15)[source]¶

Fills the framebuffer with the given color. (Full brightness if no color is given).

rstem.led_matrix.led_matrix.frame(bitmap)[source]¶

Sends the entire frame (represented in a bitmap) to the led matrix. Note: bitmap dimensions must be the same as the dimensions of the container (non rotated).

rstem.led_matrix.led_matrix.height()[source]¶
rstem.led_matrix.led_matrix.init_grid(num_rows=1, num_cols=1, angle=0, zigzag=True, math_coords=True, spi_speed=500000, spi_port=0)[source]¶

Initiallizes led matrices in a grid pattern with the given number or rows and columns. zigzag=True means the ledmatrices have been placed in a zigzag fashion. angle=0, 90, 180, or 270 to represent how the coordinate system should be

represented in the grid (num_row and num_cols are representative of after the angle has been defined)
rstem.led_matrix.led_matrix.init_matrices(mat_list=[(0, 0, 0)], math_coords=True, spi_speed=500000, spi_port=0)[source]¶

Create a chain of led matrices set at particular offsets into the frame buffer The order of the led matrices in the list indicate the order they are physically hooked up with the first one connected to Pi. mat_list = list of tuple that contains led matrix and offset

ex: [(0,0,led1),(7,0,led2)]
rstem.led_matrix.led_matrix.line(point_a, point_b, color=15)[source]¶

Create a line from point_a to point_b. Uses Bresenham’s Line Algorithm (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bresenham’s_line_algorithm)

rstem.led_matrix.led_matrix.point(x, y=None, color=15)[source]¶

Sends point to the framebuffer. Note: will not display the point until show() is called.

rstem.led_matrix.led_matrix.rect(origin, dimensions, color=15)[source]¶

Creates a rectangle from start point using given dimensions

rstem.led_matrix.led_matrix.show()[source]¶

Tells the led_driver to send framebuffer to SPI port. Refreshes the display using current framebuffer.

rstem.led_matrix.led_matrix.shutdown_matrices()[source]¶

Unintializes matrices and frees all memory. Should be called at the end of a program to avoid memory leaks. Also, clears the display.

rstem.led_matrix.led_matrix.sprite(sprite, origin=(0, 0), crop_origin=(0, 0), crop_dimensions=None)[source]¶

Sets given sprite with top left corner at given origin origin = the (x,y) coordinates to start displaying the sprite

(bottom left for math_coords, top left for programming coords)
crop_origin = the offset into the sprite that should actually be displayed
Note: crop_origin is relative to origin

crop_dimensions = the number of pixels (x, y) inside the sprite to display (None for no crop)

rstem.led_matrix.led_matrix.text(text, origin=(0, 0), crop_origin=(0, 0), crop_dimensions=None, font_name='small', font_path=None)[source]¶

Sets given string to be displayed on LED Matrix - returns the LEDText sprite object used to create text
